title: CEC Recruitment & Admin Officer Job at Chelis Bookazine Limited
content:
Chelis Bookazine Limited is Nigeria’s leading educational supplier, supplying top quality international educational books, resources and services to Nigeria’s education industry. Chelis has completely revolutionized the school supply industry in Nigeria because of the passion, creativity, total commitment and dedication we bring into our business to achieve our vision of contributing significantly to the provision of top quality, world class education in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: CEC Recruitment & Admin Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking for dynamic and proactive Recruitment & Admin Officers to join our team in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate will be a graduate with exceptional communication skill in English and proficient computer skill.
	As a Recruitment & Admin Officer, you will play a crucial role in delivering high-quality administrative services and maintaining excellent customer relations within our overseas education placement unit.


Responsibility


	Provide administrative support to the overseas education placement unit, including handling inquiries, scheduling appointments, and maintaining records.
	Assist in the recruitment process for prospective students interested in studying abroad, including conducting interviews, assessing qualifications, and providing guidance on application procedures.
	Ensure timely and efficient communication with students, parents, educational institutions, and other stakeholders via email, phone, and in-person meetings.
	Assist in organizing and participating in recruitment events, workshops, and seminars to promote international education opportunities.
	Coordinate with educational institutions and partner agencies to facilitate the admission and enrollment process for students.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of student information, application status, and relevant documentation.
	Contribute to the development and implementation of marketing strategies to attract prospective students and enhance the units visibility.
	Collaborate with team members to achieve organizational goals and targets, working independently with minimal supervision when required.


Requirement


	Bachelor's Degree in any field.
	A male candidate is most preferable for this role.
	Prior work experience in recruitment and admissions for foreign universities.
	Excellent command of English language, both written and verbal.
	Strong interpersonal skills and customer service orientation.
	Proficiency in computer applications, including Microsoft Office suite.
	Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently under minimal supervision.
	Knowledge of overseas education systems and procedures is desirable.


Salary
N110,000 - N140,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application and detailed CV to: chelisrecruitment@gmail.com using “CEC Admin and Recruitment Officer - Surulere" as the subject of the mail.

title: Internal Control Officer Job at HabariPay Limited
content:
HabariPay Limited is a Fin-tech on the path to building a truly pan-African payments unicorn with it's unique product called SQUAD. At Squad, you will have access to best in class tools and resources to enable you to solve truly complex problems, developing game changing payments solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Internal Control Officer is responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management, and governance processes.
	This role ensures that the company operates in compliance with internal policies, regulatory standards, and industry best practices, with a focus on minimizing risk and preventing fraud.


Job Duties and Responsibilities


	Design, implement, and monitor internal control systems across business processes.
	Conduct periodic risk assessments to identify control weaknesses and suggest improvements.
	Perform routine and ad-hoc audits to ensure compliance with policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
	Ensure timely documentation and maintenance of control procedures and audit trails.
	Collaborate with other departments to promote a culture of control awareness and ethical behavior.
	Review financial and operational transactions to detect errors, inconsistencies, or unusual activity.
	Monitor key business activities and control indicators to ensure continuous improvement.
	Prepare detailed audit reports and follow up on agreed corrective actions.
	Provide guidance on process improvement and risk mitigation strategies.
	Assist in investigations of suspected fraud, breaches, or irregularities.
	Ensure compliance with external regulatory requirements and internal corporate policies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in IT, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration
	Approximately total 3-5 years of internal control/assurance experience in a Financial Institution
	Professional Certifications such as ICAN, ACCA, preferred
	Experience in risk-based audit, internal financial control processes, governance frameworks, enterprise-wide risk management, prefer in banking industries
	Internal Investigation experience preferred
	Solid understanding of Internal Auditing concepts, international auditing standards and internal control frameworks Strong Analytical Skills
	Knowledge of the banking or other financial sector and Core Banking System will be an added advantage
	Displays high levels of integrity, objectivity and impartiality and commit to high professional ethical standards.

title: Project Manager Job at U Connect Human Resources Limited
content:
U Connect Human Resources Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Planning and Execution:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Managing project resources: Assigning and coordinating human, financial, and material resources.
	Monitoring project progress: Tracking milestones, identifying potential delays, and making adjustments as needed.
	Ensuring quality standards: Maintaining the quality of project deliverables and ensuring they meet stakeholder expectations.
	Defining project scope and objectives: Clearly outlining what the project aims to achieve and its boundaries.
	Developing a project plan: Creating a roadmap that includes timelines, tasks, resource allocation, and potential risks.


Communication and Collaboration:


	Communicating with stakeholders: Keeping all stakeholders informed about project status, issues, and changes.
	Leading and motivating the project team: Fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.
	Managing stakeholder expectations: Addressing concerns and ensuring stakeholder satisfaction.


Risk Management and Issue Resolution:


	Identifying and assessing project risks: Analyzing potential risks and developing mitigation strategies.
	Resolving project issues: Addressing problems that arise and taking corrective actions.
	Managing changes to the project scope: Handling changes to project requirements and ensuring they are implemented effectively.


Other Important Duties:


	Budget management: Controlling project costs and ensuring the project stays within budget.
	Project documentation: Maintaining accurate and up-to-date project records.
	Reporting project progress: Providing regular reports to stakeholders on project status.
	Ensuring project compliance: Adhering to relevant regulations and industry standards.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree qualification with 3 - 5 years of work experience. 


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send detailed CV to: u.connecthr@u-connect-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Procurement Manager Job at Carogas Energy
content:
Carogas Energy is an independent oil and gas company focused on developing and producing energy resources in Africa and beyond. We acquire and operate onshore and shallow offshore fields, ensuring efficient and responsible production.

Our work includes oilfield services, procurement, and asset management, supporting Africa’s energy sector with practical, cost-effective solutions. With a growing operational presence in Africa and across key energy markets, we continue to expand our footprint through strategic industry partnerships and operational excellence to maximize value and long-term sustainability.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Manager - Oil & Gas
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time (Hybrid)
Reports To: Managing Director / Head of Commercial
Department: Supply Chain & Commercial Operations

Job Summary


	The Procurement Manager – Oil & Gas is responsible for strategically managing procurement and vendor relations across upstream operations and services, with a focus on cost-effective sourcing, compliance, and strategic positioning in the African and Middle Eastern markets.
	The role includes overseeing sourcing, contract bidding, vendor onboarding, and registration processes with national and international oil companies (NOCs & IOCs) and oilfield service providers.
	The ideal candidate is commercially astute, technically sound, and experienced in oil & gas procurement and vendor registration protocols.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Sourcing & Procurement:


	Source, evaluate, and manage vendors for oilfield equipment, chemicals, drilling services, engineering support, and project supplies.
	Lead strategic sourcing initiatives aligned with technical and project requirements in exploration, drilling, and production operations.
	Ensure procurement meets technical specifications, delivery timelines, and cost targets.


Vendor & Partner Onboarding:


	Identify, evaluate, and onboard qualified vendors and strategic partners relevant to upstream oil & gas services.
	Develop vendor prequalification packages, manage documentation, and conduct due diligence.
	Maintain and expand a preferred vendor and partner database focused on operations in Africa and the Middle East.


Market Development & Bid Management:


	Actively identify business opportunities and contracts in the African and Middle Eastern oil & gas sectors.
	Lead proposal and bid submissions for tenders and RFPs issued by oil companies and oil service companies.
	Coordinate with technical, legal, and commercial teams to ensure bid compliance and competitiveness.


Registration & Compliance:


	Lead the process of vendor registration and prequalification with NOCs, IOCs, and EPC contractors (e.g., ADNOC, NNPC, Sonangol, ENI, Schlumberger, Halliburton, etc.).
	Ensure compliance with local content requirements and registration protocols in key markets.
	Liaise with regulatory bodies, JV partners, and local content boards where necessary.


Commercial Presentations & Stakeholder Engagement:


	Create high-quality capability presentations and bid documents tailored to client requirements.
	Represent the company at vendor presentations, pre-bid meetings, and technical evaluations with oil companies.
	Build relationships with key procurement and project teams in operating companies and oil service majors.


Cost Control & Risk Mitigation:


	Develop procurement strategies to optimize costs, quality, and supply reliability.
	Monitor supply chain risks and build contingency plans.
	Benchmark market prices and trends for major procurement categories.


Reporting & System Management:


	Implement and maintain procurement tracking systems (ERP/SAP or similar).
	Analyze spend data, procurement cycle times, and supplier performance KPIs.
	Provide regular procurement reports and dashboards to senior leadership.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field. (MBA or certifications such as CIPS, PMP, or NACE are highly desirable)
	Minimum 7–10 years of procurement experience in the Chemicals or upstream oil & gas sector, with exposure to Africa and/or the Middle East.
	In-depth knowledge of oil & gas procurement standards, logistics, HSSE, and local content regulations.
	Proven experience in vendor onboarding, bid management, and contract registration processes with IOCs/NOCs.
	Strong negotiation, analytical, and project coordination skills.
	Excellent presentation skills with the ability to engage technical and commercial stakeholders at high levels.
	Proficiency in MS Office, PowerPoint, ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle), and tender portals.


Key Competencies:


	Oil & Gas Procurement Expertise
	Contract & Bid Management
	Cross-border Regulatory Compliance
	Technical-Commercial Presentation Skills
	Negotiation & Influence
	Vendor Relations & Strategic Partnerships
	Market Intelligence (Africa & Middle East)
	Attention to Detail & Risk Awareness
	Interdepartmental Coordination


Salary
N750,000 / Month.

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Lagos
